intro: Carex owyheensis, commonly known as the Owyhees sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States, particularly found in Idaho and Oregon. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. This plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has slender, triangular stems and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear brownish flowers. The Owyhees sedge plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
